Package api

Class DWGraph_DS

java.lang.Object
api.DWGraph_DS
All Implemented Interfaces:
directed_weighted_graph
public class DWGraph_DS
extends java.lang.Object
implements directed_weighted_graph
This class implements the directed_weighted_graph interface which is a weighted directed graph with the following class variables: - HashMap _nodes - Represents the nodes in the graph as a hashmap which maps each node to his unique key. - HashMap> _edges_fromNode - maps for each nodes in the graph an Hashmap which store all the edges in the graph which are directed **from** the node (meaning: curr_node -> other_node), also holds the edge itself in the the following way >. (Example: if there is an edge from node with key 3 to node with key 5 with , than the HashMap will map the following: <3, <5, edge(3->5)>> ). - HashMap> _edges_toNode - maps for each nodes in the graph an Hashmap which store all the edges in the graph which are directed **to** the node (meaning: other_node -> curr_node), also holds the edge itself in the the following way >.(Example: if there is an edge from node with key 3 to node with key 5 , than the HashMap will map the following: <5, <3, edge(3->5)>> ). ** The following double structured Hashmap (_edges_fromNode & _edges_toNode) was chosen to support O(k) removal of nodes from this graph, when k is the degree of this node. - int _edgeSize = number of edges in the graph. - int _mc = number of actions preformed on the the graph.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addNode​(node_data n)
    Adds the provided node_data param to this graph by mapping his key to the node in _nodes, and initialzing him with an empty HashMap in both _edges_fromNode & edges_toNode.
    void connect​(int src, int dest, double w)
    Connects 2 nodes in the graph (if both exists and are not the same) by an edge from src to dest with the positive w (if w is positive), by first creating an EdgeData variable from src to dest with weight w and then mapping src> in edges_fromNode and dest> in edges_toNode.
    int edgeSize()
    returns number of edges in the graph by returning _edgeSize variable
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)  
    java.util.Collection<edge_data> getE​(int node_id)
    Returns a collection of all the edges in the graph which are directed from the node with the provided node_id (if exists), by returning the values of the internal Hashmap mapped to this node if.
    edge_data getEdge​(int src, int dest)
    Returns the edge_date which represents the edge from src to dest, by returning the mapped value in _edges_fromNode to the provided src and dest.
    int getMC()
    returns the number of actions preformed on the graph by returning the _mc variable
    node_data getNode​(int key)
    Returns the node assigned to the provided key by returning the mapped node to the key in _nodes
    java.util.Collection<node_data> getV()
    Returns a collection of all the nodes in the graph by returning the _nodes Hashmap values.
    int nodeSize()
    returns number of nodes in the graph by returning the num of mapped keys in _nodes Hashmap
    edge_data removeEdge​(int src, int dest)
    Removes the edge which is defined from src to dest (if exists) by going to edges_toNode to dest node, and removing from its mapping the src node key.
    node_data removeNode​(int key)
    Removes the node which is assigned to the following key (if exists) by doing 3 steps: First, removing all the edges which are directed from him to other nodes, meaning for each edge which is directed from this node (node -> other node), go to the edges_toNode to the other node's key, and removing the mapping of this current node.
    java.lang.String toString()
    toString method

    clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • removeNode

      public node_data removeNode​(int key)
      Removes the node which is assigned to the following key (if exists) by doing 3 steps: First, removing all the edges which are directed from him to other nodes, meaning for each edge which is directed from this node (node -> other node), go to the edges_toNode to the other node's key, and removing the mapping of this current node. Second, do the exact opposite, meaning remove each edge which is directed to this node (other node -> node), by going to the edges_fromNode to the other node's key, and removing the mapping of this current node. Third, removes the node from edges_fromNode and from nodes
      Specified by:
      removeNode in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      key - - the key of the node.
      Returns:
      the node that has been removed

    • removeEdge

      public edge_data removeEdge​(int src, int dest)
      Removes the edge which is defined from src to dest (if exists) by going to edges_toNode to dest node, and removing from its mapping the src node key. Then it will do the same on the opposite - means will go to edges_fromNode to src node, and removing from its mapping the dest node key. Also, decreases edgeSize in 1.
      Specified by:
      removeEdge in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      src - - edge source node
      dest - - edge destination node
      Returns:
      the edge that has been removed
